places.name: National Theatre Lagos
places.description: A cultural landmark in Lagos, famous for its iconic architecture and as a center for performing arts and events.

places.name: Nike Art Gallery
places.description: One of the largest art galleries in West Africa, showcasing contemporary and traditional Nigerian art.

places.name: Lekki Conservation Centre
places.description: A natural reserve with wildlife, the longest canopy walkway in Africa, and serene picnic areas.

places.name: Tarkwa Bay Beach
places.description: A popular sheltered beach, ideal for swimming, picnics, and relaxation away from the city noise.

places.name: Freedom Park Lagos
places.description: A memorial and leisure park built from an old colonial prison, now used for cultural and social events.

places.name: Jhalobia Recreation Park
places.description: A privately owned garden park with lush greenery, fountains, and event spaces.

places.name: Elegushi Beach
places.description: A lively beach with restaurants, nightlife, and entertainment popular among young people in Lagos.

places.name: Balogun Market
places.description: One of the largest markets in Lagos, offering fabrics, jewelry, household goods, and more.
